title: Enhancement: make LogProgressbar more informative for non-interactive progress feedback

labels.name: easy
labels.description: easy to fix issue, good starting point for a contribution

body:
Decided to file separate from #4320 which is largely orthogonal to this.

ATM LogProgressBar is solely reporting upon completion of an action with timing information/message, e.g. fom #4320
```
$> rm -rf datalad && datalad clone https://github.com/datalad/datalad.git  | cat
[INFO]  Enumerating done in 0.000221014 sec
[INFO]  Counting 153 Objects done in 0.0139375 sec at 10978 Objects/sec
[INFO]  Compressing 94 Objects done in 0.0118935 sec at 7903 Objects/sec
[INFO]  Receiving 69836 Objects done in 3 seconds at 19489 Objects/sec
[INFO]  Resolving 54608 Deltas done in 0.610522 sec at 89445 Deltas/sec
[INFO]  Clone attempt 2 Candidate locations done in 5 seconds at 0.398732 Candidate locations/sec
install(ok): /tmp/datalad (dataset)
```
which in itself could be improved (no need for microsec level info).  I think, especially if #4320 goes through it might be nice to adjust actual logged message and structure to make it more useful, e.g. we could
- ATM there is no alert about beginning of the action, only about the end
- issue one time log about progress of apparently (since no initial log msg, which imho is "by design") ongoing action and ETA if no specific progress bar report had come for some fixed amount of time (e.g., after 5 seconds from the beginning - which should be sufficient to guestimate ETA more or less if ETA is in more than e.g. 10 seconds), so users do get feedback on when to expect a logged operation to finish.
- issue one time log if ETA significantly delayed (e.g. would take 5 times longer than previously expected)

With above improvements log would get useful information for the cases where people monitor them, and otherwise would not flood the logs as "real time" progress bar would have done.  Also for quick operations (like during `clone`) there would only be log messages about finished actions as it is now.
